Yeah, many have used the phrase "magic boulder" to refer to the hovering scatter things.  The long-gone and long-lamented real "Magic Boulder" should always be capitalized as a sign of respect and to differentiate it from what you more appropriately call "floaters".  And "floaters" includes all types of scatter objects including the all types of vegetation on Kerbin and the spikes of Pol, not just rocks.

If you want to recreate the real Magic Boulder, you need to watch that very ancient Scott Manley video I linked above which shows it from all angles.  It was about the size of a Class C asteroid and oozed green slime, both of which are fairly easily doable.  The hard part is putting a Monolith on it and making it instantly destroy you ship if you touch it.
